document_data.name: Call Woodland Beings
document_data.mainbody: '''Call woodland beings''' was a [[conjuration]] spell that allowed the caster three chances to name a type of forest-dwelling creature, such as [[brownie]]s, [[centaur]]s, [[dryad]]s, [[pixies]], [[satyr]]s, [[sprites]], [[treant]]s, [[unicorn]]s, etc., and summon one or more of them to aid the caster.
document_data.History:
It was recorded in ''[[Yornar's Trail Companion]]'', a holy text of the [[church of Mielikki]].<ref>

In the month of [[Eleasis]], of the {{YearlinkName|1371}}, [[Chief Prelate]] [[Relarn Dayspring|Dayspring]] of the [[Clerical Circle]] of [[Ravens Bluff]] declared it illegal for priests to cast ''call woodland beings'' within city limits due to a raging unnatural storm at the time called the [[Soulstorm]], threatening arrest for those that broke this decree.{{Cite trumpeter/2-8|2}}{{LCRB}}
